comments.body: Stylistic question: do people prefer using `map2`? Ubiquitously in codebases I've worked on, it's unused, and instead people use the tuple ops, `(fa, fb).mapN(_ + _)`, which works for any number of arguments (no need to use `map2` vs `map3` vs `map4`, so on)

I was thinking of `MonadError` as a separate page just purely for the reason so that it fits on the left border of the website. Also, the original `Applicative` and `Monad` were introduced separately.  I can try to do `Applicative and Monad Error`.  I could go either way, TBH. ;)  As per `map2`, I just chose one of the `Applicative` methods. I can change it to be more realistic.
I'll try to include both on the same page with the menu and title of "Applicative and Monad Error"
I'd be happy to have two separate pages and have them link to each other.
